meanings.definition: Arranged in a spike or spikes.
meanings.sent1: The cactus had spicate thorns along its stem.
meanings.sent2: The spicate leaves of the pineapple plant were sharp and pointy.
meanings.sent3: The spicate hair of the troll doll made it look like it had a wild hairstyle.
meanings.sent4: The spicate fence surrounding the garden seemed to ward off intruders.
meanings.sent5: The spicate pattern on the fabric gave it a unique texture.

meanings.sent1: The spicate shell of the sea urchin provided protection.
meanings.sent2: The spicate tail of the lizard helped it grip onto surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The spicate edges of the metal sculpture added a modern touch.
meanings.sent4: The spicate teeth of the comb easily detangled hair.
meanings.sent5: The spicate design on the armor made it look fierce.

meanings.definition: To form a spike or spikes.
meanings.sent1: She used a hammer to spicate the metal rod into a sharp point.
meanings.sent2: The plant began to spicate as it reached for the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to spicate the dish with a sprinkle of herbs.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to spicate the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes spicated the canvas with bold lines.
